intro: Randia crassispina, commonly known as the roughleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Rubiaceae family.
